instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no disk
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that doesn't recognizes the disk. Just shows thequestion mark folder.
I don't even know where to start. Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no disk
threads.message:
Classic problem, shouldn't waste time on it.
Heat entire board on IR oven, if possible.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no disk
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no disk
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no disk
threads.message:
Heating the board didn't solved it. Same thing.

Is there any thing else that I can try?
